description: An artist with an adventurous spirit, Rockwell Kent traveled widely, gravitating to snowy locales to find the perfect vistas. For this painting, he set up a shack in remote Vermont as a studio, referring to it as a "handy refuge for a frozen realist.” This wintry view of Mount Equinox is one of a group of Kent's paintings depicting the peak in different seasons.
title: Mount Equinox, Winter
